item.title: Nancy add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "Anyone who thinks sitting in church can make you a Christian must also think that sitting in a garage can make you a car." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "Listen to the mustn'ts, child. Listen to the don'ts. Listen to the shouldn'ts, the impossibles, the won'ts. Listen to the never haves, then listen close to me... Anything can happen, child. Anything can be." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Benjamin Zander
item.description: "...how absurd human beings are and how magnificent." -- Benjamin Zander

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Harry Truman
item.description: "Fame is a vapor, popularity is an accident, riches take wings, those who cheer today may curse tomorrow and only one thing endures - character." -- Harry Truman

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Scott Adams
item.description: "Creativity is allowing yourself to make mistakes. Art is knowing which ones to keep." -- Scott Adams

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Plato
item.description: "Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something." -- Plato

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Lord George Gordon Byron
item.description: "But words are things, and a small drop of ink, Falling, like dew, upon a thought produces That which makes thousands, perhaps millions think." -- Lord George Gordon Byron

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Nancy add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "Knowing others is intelligence; knowing yourself is true wisdom. Mastering others is strength; mastering yourself is true power. If you realize that you have enough, you are truly rich." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Rudyard Kipling
item.description: "Words are, of course, the most powerful drug used by mankind." -- Rudyard Kipling

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Nearly all men can stand adversity, but if you want to test a man's character, give him power." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Dream delivers us to dream, and there is no end to illusion. Life is like a train of moods like a string of beads, and, as we pass through them, they prove to be many-colored lenses which paint the world their own hue. . . . " -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "We should take care not to make the intellect our god; it has, of course, powerful muscles, but no personality. " -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Nancy add a quote by John F. Kennedy
item.description:
"No matter how big the lie; repeat it often enough and the masses will regard it as truth.
<i>[Undated 1948 "Democratic Party"</i> speech]" -- John F. Kennedy

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "If you would be loved, love, and be loveable." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Nancy add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Everybody is a genius. But if you judge a fish by its ability to climb a tree, it will live its whole life believing that it is stupid." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Nancy add a quote by George Sand
item.description: "Guard well within yourself that treasure, kindness. Know how to give without hesitation, how to lose without regret, how to acquire without meanness." -- George Sand

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Ben Fountain
item.description: "Much of life, fatherhood included, is the story of knowledge acquired too late: if only I’d known then what I know now, how much smarter, abler, stronger, I would have been. But nothing really prepares you for kids, for the swells of emotion that roll through your chest like the rumble of boulders tumbling downhill, nor for the all-enveloping labor of it, the sheer mulish endurance you need for the six or seven hundred discrete tasks that have to be done each and every day. Such a small person! Not much bigger than a loaf of bread at first, yet it takes so much to keep the whole enterprise going. Logistics, skills, materiel; the only way we really learn is by figuring it out as we go along, and even then it changes on us every day, so we’re always improvising, which is a fancy way of saying that we’re doing things we technically don’t know how to do." -- Ben Fountain

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Hazrat Inayat Khan
item.description: "Some people look for a beautiful place, others make a place beautiful." -- Hazrat Inayat Khan
